isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Cleaning

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, leave the valves installed within the cylinder head. This protects the valve seats during the cleaning process.

step1.para: Use a rotary wire brush or a sanding block with mineral spirits to remove any deposits and gasket material from the gasket surface of the cylinder head.
Use an appropriately sized brush to clean all mounting bolt holes in the cylinder head.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, dirty or damaged bolt threads may cause binding and false torque readings.

step1.para: Clean the threads of all cylinder head mounting bolts.
Wash rocker arm assemblies, hydraulic lifters, and pushrods in a suitable solvent and dry them thoroughly. Replace any bolts that have damaged threads.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, do not use chlorinated solvents on bolts or crankcase tapped holes. Parts should be clean, dry, and free of any chemical residuals other than engine oil.
